sentences.english: It became the most successful bomber used in World War One.
sentences.chinese: 成了第一次世界大战中战功最卓著的一种轰炸机。

sentences.english: He is a very experienced general and has made great contributions in battles.
sentences.chinese: 他是名久经沙场的大将军，战功赫赫。

sentences.english: The soldier was so brave that he won honour in war.
sentences.chinese: 那位战士很勇敢，立了战功。

sentences.english: He performed outstanding military exploits and became famous as the resourceful one-eyed general.
sentences.chinese: 屡建战功，以足智多谋的“独目将军”闻名于世。

sentences.english: Sun Jian in with the help of the illustrious military exploits the way troops.
sentences.chinese: 在孙坚的帮助下，这一路部队战功显赫。

sentences.english: This famous unit had rendered the highest service.
sentences.chinese: 这支赫赫有名的部队曾立过很大的战功。

sentences.english: After the year you can still use the product but don't have exploits updates.
sentences.chinese: 一年之后你仍然可以使用，但没有战功产品更新。

sentences.english: This included a large batch of the people who had offered outstanding military services during the war times.
sentences.chinese: 其中包括大批战争年代立过战功的人。

sentences.english: Another of his Achievements was the battle of Nola.
sentences.chinese: 他的另一个战功是诺拉战役。

sentences.english: He was wearing a military greatcoat with a single row of campaign ribbons.
sentences.chinese: 他身穿一件军大衣，上面挂着一排战功纪念绶带。

sentences.english: He was cited for his distinguished service in the battle.
sentences.chinese: 他的出色战功得到表彰。

sentences.english: He was confered a medal to set forth his military exploits.
sentences.chinese: 他被授予一枚勋章，以表彰他的卓越战功。

sentences.english: And his fame came to the king, and all nations told of the battles of Judas.
sentences.chinese: 犹大的名声传到了君王那里，异民都称述他的战功。

definition: achievement/meritorious deed/contributions (for the good of society)
to confer a title/to ennoble/to knight/title of nobility
to render meritorious service/to make worthy contributions/to distinguish oneself
order of feudal nobility, namely: Duke 公[gong1], Marquis 侯[hou2], Count 伯[bo2], Viscount 子[zi3], Baron 男[nan2]
an official position/a job in the bureaucracy
to be brave and good at fighting (idiom)
general/high-ranking military officer/to check or checkmate/fig. to embarrass/to challenge/to put sb on the spot
Chiangchun township in Tainan county 台南縣|台南县[Tai2 nan2 xian4], Taiwan
to receive fief and title/to be enfeoffed/(fig.) to be rewarded by the emperor
